page.title: 12NW.SHERBORNE:TUCKER'S CROSS
page.content: The place where Kitton Lane, Hart's Lane and Oatcroft Lane meet near the top of Charlock Hill is known locally as{Tucker's Cross.}It is said to have this name because a man called Tucker, who had committed{suicide,}was buried here. Suicides were not at one time allowed to be buried in the churchyard.{Crossroads}were also often places where criminals were hanged. Nowadays there is an annual{ {Horse-riders' Service}held here: all the lanes which meet here are bridle tracks. In one corner there is a dutch barn: the field diagonally opposite the barn is used for growing{turf } which is cut away from the hill by a special machine and then taken away by truck to be sold. Water is pumped up to the nearby fields by a{hydraulic {ram}in the valley below.
